p: Fibrich et al. investigated how dermal aging is characterized by states of oxidative stress, chronic inflammation, and abnormal proteolytic degradation. This study focused on Myrsine africana and its active compounds, myrsinoside B and their ability to reduce the activity of hydrogen peroxide, superoxide and 5-lipoxygenase as supplementary mechanisms, ultimately to reduce the appearance of wrinkles. The samples showed the potential to be used as antiwrinkle agents as they indicated promising antioxidant and anti-inflammatory activity ( Fibrich et al.).
